thread.title: France manager Didier Deschamps praises Olivier Giroud who continues to answer critics with goals
thread.title_full: France manager Didier Deschamps praises Olivier Giroud who continues to answer critics with goals

author: fnathan
title: France manager Didier Deschamps praises Olivier Giroud who continues to answer critics with goals
text:
giroud health France manager Didier Deschamps praises Olivier Giroud who continues to answer critics with goals 
Arsenal striker has played a bit part role this season for his club but is now in the top-10 France goalscorers By Fred Nathan 26th March 2017, 4:07 pm Updated: 26th March 2017, 4:23 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FRANCE manager Didier Deschamps has heaped praise on Arsenal striker Olivier Giroud, who continues to answer critics with goals. 
The 30-year-old has played a bit part role this season for the Gunners but is now in the top-10 France goalscorers after netting twice in their 3-1 win in Luxembourg. Getty Images 4 Giroud celebrates giving France the lead last night against Luxemboug 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Atletico Madrid’s Antoine Griezmann scored the other the World Cup qualifier in which Giroud started – a rarity for him this term. 
He has began just seven matches in a disappointing Premier League season for Arsenal – but has still managed to score 12 for Arsene Wenger. Getty Images 4 Olivier Giroud is out of favour at the Emirates 
And while Giroud failed to score his two other Group A appearances for Les Bleus, Deschamps justified selecting him when he produced the goods yesterday. 
After being told by a reporter that he was right to keep faith in Giroud, Dechamps said: “Thank you, but that is his merit and I will not take it off him. Getty Images 4 Giroud is now in the top 10 all-time scorers for France 
“The position of striker is always a big responsibility – it attracts a lot of criticism. Sometimes it is unfair like before the Euro, when he responded. most read in football Not good enough Antonio Conte has sensationally rejected the chance to sign Neymar in a £155m deal from Barcelona leg-break horror Seamus Coleman set for surgery on potential career-threatening injury after his leg is snapped in half by Neil Taylor's wild tackle TV TIMES What TV channel is England vs Lithuania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? LIONHEART Brave Bradley Lowery gets the biggest cheer at Wembley as he leads out the England team with goal hero and best mate Jermain Defoe Seeing Red Keith Gillespie launches viscous elbow into face of opponent during Man United charity match 'I don't even like football' Neil Taylor is hammered on Twitter after breaking Seamus Coleman’s leg… but it’s an ex-councillor not the Wales defender taking the brunt of the abuse 
“I discussed it with him at length. He realises that he is not having his best season. He was a bit bothered by injuries, but despite everything, he scores. 
“I trusted him by putting him in because I know what he can do in this type of game. Good for him.” Arsenal's Giroud, Monreal and Cech try their hand at refereeing for Betfair's Back The Whistleblowers Campaign 
Giroud moved into the top-10 of all-time top France scorers with his double in Luxembourg - but his future at the Emirates is often shrouded in speculation. 
He lost his place as Arsenal's first-choice striker to Alexis Sanchez this season, admitting it has been hard to take and he has had discussions with under-fire boss Arsene Wenger about it. Arsenal striker Olivier Giroud shows off his new luminous Puma football boots 
He said: "For me, the most difficult moment was after scoring an important goal against Manchester United, I thought I had scored some points and would start against PSG… but no. 
"So I asked to speak to the coach to understand. I accept his decisions but I tell him what I think, without being negative, without antagonising. Reuters 4 Giroud and Arsene Wenger's have had frank discussions about his lack of playing time 
"There are no misunderstandings between us. The coach explained to me that he was adopting this system [4-2-3-1] to find a defensive balance. 
"Sometimes, I played with Sanchez on the left, but the rest of time I have to adapt to the tactical decisions. 
"I understand the notion of balance once the ball is lost."
